19#include "BitArray.h"
20#include "Pattern.h"
21
22#include <memory>
23#include <stdexcept>
24
25namespace ZXing {
26
27class BitArray;
28class BitMatrix;
29
30/**
31* This class is the core bitmap class used by ZXing to represent 1 bit data. Reader objects
32* accept a BinaryBitmap and attempt to decode it.
33*
34* @author dswitkin@google.com (Daniel Switkin)
35*/
36class BinaryBitmap
37{
38public:
39 virtual ~BinaryBitmap() = default;
40
41 /**
42 * Image is a pure monochrome image of a barcode.
43 */
44 [[deprecated]]
45 virtual bool isPureBarcode() const { return false; }
46
47 /**
48 * @return The width of the bitmap.
49 */
50 virtual int width() const = 0;
51
52 /**
53 * @return The height of the bitmap.
54 */
55 virtual int height() const = 0;
56
57 /**
58 * Converts one row of luminance data to 1 bit data.
59 * This method is intended for decoding 1D barcodes and may choose to apply sharpening.
60 *
61 * @param y The row to fetch, which must be in [0, bitmap height)
62 * @param row An optional preallocated array. If null or too small, it will be ignored.
63 * If used, the Binarizer will call BitArray.clearBits(). Always use the returned object.
64 * @return The array of bits for this row (true means black).
65 * @throws NotFoundException if row can't be binarized
66 */
67 virtual bool getBlackRow(int y, BitArray& outArray) const = 0;
68
69 virtual bool getPatternRow(int y, PatternRow& res) const
70 {
71 res.clear();
72 BitArray row;
73 getBlackRow(y, row);
74
75 auto li = row.begin();
76 auto i = li;
77 if( *i )
78 res.push_back(0);
79 while ((i = row.getNextSetTo(i, !*i)) != row.end()) {
80 res.push_back(i - li);
81 li = i;
82 }
83 res.push_back(i - li);
84
85 return true;
86 }
87
88 /**
89 * Converts a 2D array of luminance data to 1 bit. This method is intended for decoding 2D
90 * barcodes and may or may not apply sharpening. Therefore, a row from this matrix may not be
91 * identical to one fetched using getBlackRow(), so don't mix and match between them.
92 *
93 * @return The 2D array of bits for the image (true means black).
94 * @return null if image can't be binarized to make a matrix
95 */
96 virtual std::shared_ptr<const BitMatrix> getBlackMatrix() const = 0;
97
98 /**
99 * @return Whether this bitmap can be cropped.
100 */
101 virtual bool canCrop() const { return false; }
102
103 /**
104 * Returns a new object with cropped image data. Implementations may keep a reference to the
105 * original data rather than a copy. Only callable if isCropSupported() is true.
106 *
107 * @param left The left coordinate, which must be in [0,getWidth())
108 * @param top The top coordinate, which must be in [0,getHeight())
109 * @param width The width of the rectangle to crop.
110 * @param height The height of the rectangle to crop.
111 * @return A cropped version of this object.
112 */
113 virtual std::shared_ptr<BinaryBitmap> cropped(int /*left*/, int /*top*/, int /*width*/, int /*height*/) const
114 {
115 throw std::runtime_error("This binarizer does not support cropping.");
116 }
117
118 /**
119 * @return Whether this bitmap supports counter-clockwise rotation.
120 */
121 virtual bool canRotate() const { return false; }
122
123 /**
124 * Returns a new object with rotated image data by 90 degrees clockwise.
125 * Only callable if {@link #isRotateSupported()} is true.
126 *
127 * @param degreeCW degree in clockwise direction, possible values are 90, 180 and 270
128 * @return A rotated version of this object.
129 */
130 virtual std::shared_ptr<BinaryBitmap> rotated(int /*degreeCW*/) const
131 {
132 throw std::runtime_error("This binarizer does not support rotation.");
133 }
134};
135
136} // ZXing
137
